summary: THE VEHICLE HAS CAUGHT FIRE UNDERNEATH THE DASHBOARD AND AFTER FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED THAT IT WAS PRODUCED BY A ELECTRICAL HARNESS BEING PINCHED ON THE LEFT SIDE FRONT BETWEEN THE WALL AND THE FRAME OF THE DASHBOARD.  VEHICLE WAS IN MOTION.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2010 FOREST RIVER GEORGETOWN. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE BOLT FRACTURED ON THE RETRACTABLE TRIPLE STEP. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO A DEALER WHERE IT WAS DIAGNOSED THAT THE BRACKET NEEDED TO BE REPLACED FOR THE ELECTRIC STEP ENTRY. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. IT WAS UNKNOWN IF THE VEHICLE WAS INCLUDED IN NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 15V798000 (EQUIPMENT). THE VIN WAS UNKNOWN. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 24,833.

HELP PLEASE  INCIDENT, TWICE CAMPING, STATIONARY AND ONCE ON THE STREET, ALSO STATIONARY.  I HAVE RESEARCHED FOR ANY RECALLS AND FOUND RECALL # 15V798000, PROBLEM CONCERNING THE DOUBLE AND TRIPLE STEPS, A BOLT MAY FRACTURE ALLOWING THE FAN GEAR TO DISENGAGE FROM THE STEPS....I PHONED LIPPERT AND SPOKE WITH A [XXX] , I EXPRESSED MY CONCERN TO HIM REGARDING THE CONTINUED FRACTURE BOLT, IF IT MAY POSSIBLY BE CAUSED BY THE RECALL. [XXX]  THEN INSTRUCTED ME TO SEARCH FOR A MOTORHOME  SERVICE CENTER WHOM WILL WORK ON RECALLS, THEY WILL THEN CONTACT LIPPERT WITH THEIR FINDINGS AND DETERMINE THE OUTCOME. I FOUND CORDELIA RV IN FAIRFIELD. AFTER SEVERAL WEEKS THEY HAVE CONTACTED LIPPERRT, TODAY I RECEIVE AN EMAIL FROM [XXX].  , STATING THE MOTORHOME HAS NOT BEEN AFFECTED BY THE RECALL BUT DOES NEED THE BOLT REPLACED (I STATED THIS IN OUR INITIAL CONVERSATION OF CONCERN) AS WELL AS THE BALL JOINT ASSEMBLY.  I HAVE ATTEMPTED TO PHONE [XXX] BUT HAVE NOT HEARD FROM HIM AS OF YET (3 HOURS)   I HAVE GONE INTO FURTHER DEPT WITH RESEARCHING THIS PROBLEM WITH THE STEP...I HAVE FOUND TWO FORUMS WITH MULTIPLE PAGES OF THIS EXACT PROBLEM....INJURIES HAVE OCCURRED, EVEN TO AN EMPLOYER.   SOME HAVE CONTACTED THE WARRANTY, AFTER EXPIRATION AND HAD IT REPLACED ANYHOW DUE TO THE MANY COMPLAINTS. THE STEPS WERE REPLACED WITH A KWIKEE BRAND, WHICH HAS REPORTED TO BE BETTER BUILT. MANY, AS MYSELF, ARE SURPRISED AS TO WHY THIS STEP PROBLEM HAS NOT BECOME A "RECALL"  I AM SEEKING FOR THE STEP TO BE REPLACED FOR FREE, THIS HAS BEEN A PROBLEMATIC ORDEAL, NO FOLLOW UP CALLS FROM CORDELIA AND NO ANSWER FROM LIPPERT WHEN I CALL AS EMAIL INSTRUCTED.  I DO NOT HAVE ANY PICTURES AT THIS MOMENT, THE RV IS STILL IN THE HANDS OF CORDELIA RV. THE BOLT THAT CONTINUES TO FRACTURE IS THE LEFT, TOP BOLT (FACING THE STEP FROM THE OUTSIDE)    THANK YOU FOR YOUR ATTENTION,    [XXX]       INFORMATION REDACTED PURSUANT TO THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. 552(B)(6).  *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2010 FOREST RIVER GEORGETOWN. WHILE ATTEMPTING TO USE THE ELECTRIC STEPS, THE STEPS WOULD MAKE AN ABNORMAL NOISE AND WORK INTERMITTENTLY. THE RV WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER WHERE THE RECALL WAS ACKNOWLEDGED. THE CONTACT RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 15V798000 (EQUIPMENT); HOWEVER, THE PART TO DO THE REPAIR WAS UNAVAILABLE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE MANUFACTURER EXCEEDED A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF TIME FOR THE RECALL REPAIR. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 15,400.

components: SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC,ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING,ELECTRONIC STABILITY CONTROL
summary: HYDRAULIC HOSE BROKE AT AFFECTING LEVELING OF VEHICLE.  NEEDED TO REPLACE HOSE BEFORE BEING ABLE TO MOVE VEHICLE.  HOSE BROKE AT COMPRESSION CONNECTOR.  A DIFFERENT  HOSE BROKE 5 WEEKS LATER.  IN 2013 WHILE AT THE FOREST RIVER SERVICE CENTER IN ELKHART IN., THE SERVICE PERSON TOLD ME THEY HAD NEVER HEARD OF THIS PROBLEM.  NOTHING WAS DONE TO PREPARE FOR ANOTHER SUCH THING FROM HAPPENING.  *TR

DISCOVERED A MAJOR DEFECT WITH ALL OF THE RETURN ORANGE HYDRAULIC HOSES USED WITHIN THE  ROOM SLIDE AND STABILIZING JACK SYSTEM WITH THE MOTOR HOME.  THE DEFECT IS SEVERE BLISTERING (OR BUBBLING) WHICH OCCURS OVER THE ENTIRE LENGTH OF THE HYDRAULIC LINE.  AS THE SYSTEM OPERATES AT HIGH PRESSURE, THESE BLISTERS WILL EVENTUALLY RUPTURE CAUSING A COMPLETE LOSE OF HYDRAULIC FLUID AND PRESSURE WITHIN THE ENTIRE SYSTEM.  THIS LACK OF PRESSURE WILL CAUSE ALL OF THE STABILIZER JACKS TO FALL/DEPLOY AND FOR THE POTENTIAL ROOM SLIDE EXTENSIONS TO EXTEND/DEPLOY. THIS IS AN DANGEROUS/EXTREME/SERIOUS HAZARD IF THIS HAPPENS AT HIGHWAY SPEED.  FOREST RIVER ADMITS TO THE DEFECT AND HAS RECENTLY CHANGED HOSE MANUFACTURES.  THEY ARE ALSO COVERING THE REPLACEMENT OF THE HOSES FOR ORIGINAL OWNERS WHO ARE WITHIN THE ONE YEAR WARRANTY PERIOD.  ALL OTHERS ARE ON THEIR OWN TO DISCOVER AND RESOLVE THIS PROBLEM.  THIS IS KNOWN TO IMPACT FOREST RIVER GEORGETOWN MODEL YEARS 2010 THROUGH 2012.  SEE THE FOLLOWING FOR MORE DETAILS FROM MANY OWNERS WITH THE SAME COMPLAINT/ISSUE/CONCERN.    HTTP://WWW.FORESTRIVERFORUMS.COM/FORUMS/F16/BULGES-IN-HYDRAULIC-HOSES-15697.HTML    NOTE: CONTEXT FOR THE POTENTIAL FOR SERIOUS INJURY AND WORKINGS OF THE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM WAS TAKEN FROM A FOREST RIVER AUTHORIZED REPAIR CENTER AFTER LOOKING OVER MY UNIT AND DISCUSSING THE BLISTERING LINES.  A STATEMENT FROM THE REPAIR CENTER CAN BE PROVIDED IF NEEDED. *TR  UPDATED 7/11/12 *CN  UPDATED 07/26/12*LJ

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2010 FOREST RIVER GEORGETOWN MOTOR HOME. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING 55 MPH, THE STEERING WHEEL AND STEERING GEAR BOX FAILED, CAUSING THE CONTACT TO LOSE CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER WHO KEPT THE VEHICLE FOR ALMOST TWO WEEKS AND RETURNED IT TO THE CONTACT WITHOUT BEING REPAIRED.  THE WAS UNSURE AS TO WHY THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 4,000.
